item.title: 美国东海岸码头工人批准为期六年的新合同
item.description: 本周二，国际码头工人协会（ILA）代表的 45,000 多名美国码头工人投票批准了一份为期六年的新合同，从而正式达成了一项协议，该协议曾在 10 月份导致从缅因州到德克萨斯州的港口短暂停工。【原文：Over 45,000 U.S. dockworkers represented by the International Longshoremen's Association (ILA) voted to ratify a new six-year contract on Tuesday, formalizing a deal which briefly stopped work at ports stretching from Maine to Texas in October.】

item.title: 美国库存报告有助于抵消对供应增加的担忧，石油随之上扬
item.description: 周三亚洲早盘时段，油价攀升，从上一交易日触及的两个月低点反弹，此前一个行业组织报告称上周美国原油库存下降。【原文：Oil prices climbed in early Asian trading hours on Wednesday, bouncing off two-month lows hit in the prior session, after an industry group reported U.S. crude stockpiles fell last week.】

item.title: 独家报道消息称日本邮政计划 40 亿美元出售日本邮政银行股份
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，日本邮政控股公司正计划出售日本邮政银行的股份，总额可能达到约 6000 亿日元（约合 40.2 亿美元），这是日本邮政控股公司与日本邮政银行之间关系的最新松动。【原文：Japan Post Holdings is planning to sell shares in Japan Post Bank which could total some 600 billion yen ($4.02 billion), two sources familiar with the matter said, in the latest loosening of ties between the businesses.】

item.title: 经济数据疲软，关税忧虑升温，美元跌至11周低点附近
item.description: 周三，美元兑主要货币汇率跌至11周低点附近，在一系列疲软的经济数据之后，短期国债收益率下滑给美元带来了压力。【原文：The U.S. dollar sagged near an 11-week low against its major peers on Wednesday, under pressure from sliding short-term Treasury yields after a run of weak economic data.】

item.title: 20 国集团财长和央行行长将在纷争不断的地缘政治中举行会议
item.description: 二十国集团（G20）主要经济体的财政部长和央行行长将于周三和周四齐聚南非，此次会议因主要成员缺席或减少出席会议，以及在气候、债务和不平等等主要问题上的争议而受到影响。【原文：Finance ministers and central bankers from the G20 top economies gather in South Africa on Wednesday and Thursday, for a meeting marred by the absence or curtailed attendance of key members and disputes over the main issues of climate, debt and inequality.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，Meta 正在洽谈价值 2000 亿美元的人工智能数据中心项目
item.description: 据 The Information 周二援引知情人士的话报道，Meta Platforms 公司正在讨论为其人工智能项目建造一个新的数据中心园区，潜在成本将超过 2000 亿美元。【原文：Meta Platforms is in discussions to construct a new data center campus for its artificial intelligence projects, with potential costs exceeding $200 billion, The Information reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 在 Vanguard 筹集基金董事会投票之际，反 ESG 的担忧困扰着 Vanguard
item.description: 美国一些共和党州的财务主管将拒绝为先锋基金董事会提名的候选人投票，因为他们担心候选人名单在可持续发展问题上 "语气平淡"，这给这家顶级共同基金管理公司带来了政治障碍，因为该公司希望在周三举行的罕见的基金托管人选举中提高投票率。【原文：A group of Republican U.S. state treasurers will withhold votes for Vanguard fund board nominees on concerns the slate is "tone-deaf" on sustainability matters, presenting a political hurdle for the top mutual fund manager as it looks to build turnout for a rare fund trustee election on Wednesday.】

item.title: 贸易争端后，墨西哥正式禁止种植转基因玉米
item.description: 分析人士说，墨西哥国会下议院周二批准了一项宪法改革，禁止种植转基因玉米，此举可能导致在贸易争端解决后与美国的关系更加紧张。【原文：Mexico's lower house of Congress on Tuesday approved a constitutional reform to ban the planting of genetically modified (GM) corn, a move that could lead to more tension with the United States after the resolution of a trade dispute, analysts said.】

item.title: Keysight Technologies 季度利润超出预期，预计第二季度业绩强劲
item.description: 电子设备制造商 Keysight Technologies 预计其第二季度利润将超过分析师的预期。【原文：Electronic equipment maker Keysight Technologies expects its second-quarter profit to surpass analysts' estimates, following a robust quarterly profit on Tuesday.】

item.title: WiseTech Global 任命亿万富翁创始人理查德-怀特为执行主席
item.description: 澳大利亚物流软件制造商慧科全球（WiseTech Global）周三任命理查德-怀特（Richard White）为公司执行董事长，尽管公司董事会和投资者对这位亿万富翁创始人的角色仍存在分歧，因为在此之前他曾引发了一系列争议。【原文：Australian logistics software maker WiseTech Global appointed Richard White as its executive chairman on Wednesday, even as the firm's board and investors remain split over the billionaire founder's role following a flurry of controversies.】

item.title: 波音公司称斯蒂芬妮-波普不再担任首席运营官
item.description: 波音公司周二表示，自2月19日起，斯蒂芬妮-波普不再担任该公司的首席运营官。【原文：Boeing said on Tuesday Stephanie Pope is no longer the chief operating officer at the planemaker as of February 19.】

item.title: 拉斯维加斯业务强劲，凯撒娱乐第四季度实现盈利
item.description: 凯撒娱乐公司（Caesars Entertainment）周二宣布，在拉斯维加斯赌场业务强劲表现的推动下，公司第四季度从去年同期的亏损转为盈利。【原文：Caesars Entertainment on Tuesday swung to a fourth-quarter profit from a year-ago loss, driven by strong performance from its casino operations in Las Vegas.】

item.title: 沃尔格林支付 5.95 亿美元解决 COVID 测试合同纠纷
item.description: 沃尔格林表示，它已与远程医疗提供商 Everly Health Solutions 达成和解协议，作为协议的一部分，连锁药店运营商将就 COVID-19 检测合同纠纷向该公司支付 5.95 亿美元。【原文：Walgreens said it had entered into a settlement agreement with telemedicine provider Everly Health Solutions as part of which the pharmacy chain operator will pay the company $595 million over a contract dispute for COVID-19 testing.】

item.title: 博雅银行取消招聘和面试候选人的多元化目标
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）领导下迎接新的商业环境时，取消了一些多元化举措。【原文：Bank of America has scrapped some of its diversity initiatives as it navigates a new business climate under U.S. President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 票房大卖带动强劲需求，AMC 收入超额完成目标
item.description: AMC Entertainment 周二的季度收入超过了华尔街的预期，这主要得益于《莫阿娜 2》（Moana 2）和《邪恶》（Wicked）等影片的热映，吸引了大批电影观众。【原文：AMC Entertainment topped Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue on Tuesday, boosted by wildly popular releases including "Moana 2" and "Wicked" that helped draw a strong crowd of moviegoers.】

item.title: 安森美今年将在重组中裁员近 2400 人
item.description: 芯片制造商 Onsemi 在周二提交的一份文件中说，该公司已启动了一项旨在降低运营成本的重组计划，该计划将导致全球所有业务部门在 2025 年裁员约 2400 人。【原文：Onsemi has initiated a restructuring plan aimed at reducing operational costs, which would result in the laying off of about 2,400 of its employees across all business divisions worldwide in 2025, the chipmaker said in a filing on Tuesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚伍尔沃斯公司上半年利润下降 21
item.description: 伍尔沃斯集团（Woolworths Group）周三报告称，其半年基本利润下降了近 21%，原因是为吸引价格敏感型顾客而提高折扣率挤压了利润空间，并影响了其主要部门的盈利。【原文：Woolworths Group reported a nearly 21% drop in its half-year underlying profit on Wednesday, as higher discounts to lure price-conscious customers squeezed margins and impacted earnings across its key divisions.】

item.title: First Solar 预计 2025 年销售额将增长，并对晶科能源采取法律行动
item.description: 太阳能电池板制造商第一太阳能公司（First Solar）周二预测今年的销售额将有所增长，第四季度利润将有所上升，并表示已对晶科能源的专利侵权行为提起法律诉讼。【原文：Solar panel maker First Solar forecast higher current-year sales, and posted a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Tuesday, and said it has initiated legal action against JinkoSolar for patent infringement.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司批准进一步暂停 E175-E2 喷气式飞机的研制工作
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）周二发布的一份证券文件显示，该公司董事会批准将E175-E2喷气机的研发计划再暂停四年。【原文：Brazilian plane maker Embraer said on Tuesday its board approved an additional four-year pause in the development program of E175-E2 jet, according to a securities filing.】

item.title: 卡瓦集团年度销售增长目标低于预期
item.description: 卡瓦集团（Cava Group）周二预测，由于美国外出就餐需求疲软，餐馆不得不对今年的预期持谨慎态度，因此全年同店销售额的增幅将大大低于预期。【原文：Cava Group on Tuesday forecast annual same-store sales growth largely below estimates as weak demand for dining out in the United States forces restaurants to take a cautious stance on their expectations for the year.】

item.title: 早间竞价：对美国经济增长的担忧和科技股下跌导致债券收益率下滑
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: Axon Enterprise 预测 2025 年业绩强劲，季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 由于软件产品和 TASER 设备的需求持续强劲，Axon Enterprise 周二预计全年收入将超过预期。【原文：Axon Enterprise forecast its annual revenue above estimates on Tuesday, following robust quarterly results, banking on sustained strong demand for its software products and TASER devices.】

item.title: 需求稳定，Workday 季度收入超出预期
item.description: 周二，Workday 第四季度营收超出华尔街预期，得益于客户在经济放缓的情况下增加支出，对其人力资本管理软件的需求强劲。【原文：Workday beat Wall Street expectations for fourth-quarter revenue on Tuesday, benefiting from strong demand for its human capital management software as clients increased spending in an easing economy.】

item.title: 麦当劳撇开鸡蛋附加费吸引顾客
item.description: 麦当劳周二表示，在提供鸡蛋作为餐食的一部分时不会征收任何附加费用，还将在其应用程序上推出1美元的麦松饼，以吸引美国消费者。【原文：McDonald's said on Tuesday it would not impose any surcharges when serving eggs as part of its meals and will also launch $1 McMuffins on its app, in a move to attract consumers in the United States.】

item.title: 特朗普下令对美国进口铜进行新的关税调查
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周二开辟了他攻击全球贸易准则的另一条战线，下令对可能对进口铜征收的新关税展开新的调查，以重建美国对电动汽车、军事硬件、半导体和各种消费品至关重要的金属的生产。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday opened yet another front in his assault on global trade norms, ordering a new probe into possible new tariffs on copper imports to rebuild U.S. production of a metal critical to electric vehicles, military hardware, semiconductors and a wide range of consumer goods.】

item.title: Lucid 表示首席执行官将卸任，今年汽车产量将增加一倍多
item.description: 电动汽车制造商 Lucid 集团周二表示，公司首席执行官彼得-罗林森（Peter Rawlinson）将卸任，公司股价在盘后交易中上涨了 6%。【原文：Electric-vehicle maker Lucid Group said on Tuesday its Chief Executive Officer Peter Rawlinson will step down from the role, sending the company's shares up 6% in extended trading.】

item.title: 澳大利亚林纳斯稀土公司上半年利润因价格疲软而大幅下滑
item.description: 澳大利亚林纳斯稀土公司（Lynas Rare Earths）周三报告称，受变现价格疲软和中国需求低迷的影响，该公司上半年利润降幅超过预期。【原文：Australia's Lynas Rare Earths reported a steeper-than-expected drop in its first-half profit on Wednesday, hurt by soft realised prices and subdued demand from China.】

item.title: Intuit 的人工智能财务工具提高了第三季度收入预期
item.description: TurboTax 制造商 Intuit 周二预测第三季度营收将高于华尔街预期，押注其人工智能驱动的金融服务软件的需求增长，这使得该公司股价在延时交易中上涨了近 3%。【原文：TurboTax maker Intuit forecast third-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Tuesday, betting on growing demand for its AI-driven financial services software, sending the company's shares up nearly 3% in extended trading.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟发现公司发言人称关闭三家电子游戏工作室
item.description: 华纳兄弟发现公司（Warner Bros Discovery）游戏部门发言人周二表示，该公司将关闭三个电子游戏开发工作室，此举的目的是在市场复苏乏力的情况下提高游戏部门的盈利能力。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery is shutting down three of its videogame development studios in a move aimed at boosting profitability for its gaming division amid a sluggish recovery in the market, a spokesperson for the company's games unit said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 部长表示，尽管面临关税威胁，加拿大仍有可能参与赛峰集团工厂的竞标
item.description: 加拿大工业部长周二表示，尽管美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）下周可能会对加拿大征收 25% 的关税，但加拿大仍然是法国赛峰集团碳制动器工厂的竞争者。【原文：Canada remains a contender for a carbon brakes factory from France's Safran , the Canadian industry minister said on Tuesday, despite the looming threat of 25% tariffs next week from U.S. President Donald Trump.】
